page.title: 05N.U.M. Strike continued.
page.content: As the strike wore on enormous stock piles of coal built up and interrupted the work schedules.The restoration of some land had to be halted as had the excavating of new seams.A crushing plant was brought to the site and all coal produced since the strike began has been processed on site and transported directly to power stations in Yorkshire.A weigh station had to be built.N.U.M.members did not picket the site,but did make regular visits to Buckhead to ensure that no coal was being moved away.After a visit to the Opencast Site and having seen the different stratas of earth,we can hardly believe that one day in the near future it will be flat farm land again. We will always remember what lies underneath.
